title: How To Train Your Dog To Wait
summary: The first step in getting your dog to wait is to get him to stop following you when you leave the room. It’s important that you don’t physically keep your dog in one place by holding his collar, wrapping a leash around his chest, or using any kind of physical restraint. This can create an association in the dog's mind that you doing this means he should stay put. You can use shaping techniques to help your dog learn to wait for longer periods of time.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"The Basics of Teaching a Dog to Wait"),mdx("p",null,"The first step in teaching your dog to wait is to get him to understand the word \u201CWait\u201D. This could be a word you use exclusively for this purpose, or it could be one of the many \u201CC\u201D and \u201CK\u201D words that dogs already understand and we use all the time. Whichever word you choose, you should be consistent about using it for this purpose only."),mdx("p",null,"While you\u2019re working on this training, it\u2019s important that you don\u2019t physically keep your dog in one place by holding his collar, wrapping a leash around his chest, or using any kind of physical restraint. This can create an association in the dog\u2019s mind that you doing this means he should stay put. But if you want to keep him in one place while you\u2019re not there, you\u2019ll need to use a different method that doesn\u2019t give him negative associations with your presence."),mdx("h2",null,"Establishing a \u201CWait\u201D Command"),mdx("p",null,`The first step in getting your dog to wait is to get him to stop following you when you leave the room. The way to do this is to say the word \u201CWait\u201D, and then leave the room.
Once he\u2019s by himself in the room, he will probably start wondering what he\u2019s supposed to do now. It\u2019s at this point that he might start scratching at the door or jumping at it in an attempt to follow you. If he does, praise him and tell him \u201CWait\u201D again, but don\u2019t let him out of the room.
Wait until he\u2019s stopped scratching or pawing at the door, and then go back into the room and praise him again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Reinforcing Behaviors You Like"),mdx("p",null,`Once you\u2019ve gotten your dog to understand the word \u201CWait\u201D and you\u2019ve begun to train him to stay in the room, you can start rewarding him for staying put. Rewarding him can take a number of different forms, but it\u2019s important that you only reward him while he\u2019s waiting, not while he\u2019s scratching at the door.
Wait until he\u2019s relaxed and stopped pawing at the door, and then praise him and give him a small treat.
This can be a great way to reinforce the \u201CWait\u201D command, and it can help him associate the command with something positive.`),mdx("h2",null,"Shaping Behaviors You Want"),mdx("p",null,`As you progress with your training, you can use shaping techniques to help your dog learn to wait for longer periods of time. This process will help him associate waiting with the door or barrier you want him to stay behind and not with you or your actions.
Wait until he\u2019s relaxed and stopped pawing or scratching at the door, and then stand next to the barrier with the treat in your hand and wait again.
When he turns away from the door, even if he\u2019s still waiting and looking in that direction, praise him and give him the treat.
Wait until he turns away from the barrier again, and then repeat.
Once he\u2019s good at this, you can start introducing other distractions that are happening in the room with him.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to Build on What You\u2019ve Taught So Far"),mdx("p",null,`Once you\u2019ve gotten your dog to understand that he should stay in the room and not follow you when you leave, you can start adding new behaviors to the process while keeping the other ones consistent.
Once he\u2019s waiting by the door or barrier, you can walk away from him and give him the \u201CWait\u201D command.
When he turns away from the door and starts to follow you, tell him \u201CWait\u201D again with a slight pause between the two words.
Wait until he turns away from the door again and then praise him and let him follow you.
Continue this process until he\u2019s good at following you while remaining in the room.`),mdx("h2",null,"Wrapping Up"),mdx("p",null,"As you continue working with your dog, you can start to add more distractions to the process, such as having people in the room or having other dogs with him. You can also start experimenting with new environments and see how your dog does waiting in other places."),mdx("p",null,"The important thing to remember is that you must be consistent with your training and you must reward your dog for doing what you want him to do. If you don\u2019t, you\u2019ll find that you\u2019ll get nowhere with your training, and your dog may even stop following the \u201CWait\u201D command you\u2019ve already taught him."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always on Their Phone

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Now and again, your significant other will probably spend more time with their phone than with you. After all, it\u2019s 2018, and smartphones are practically a necessity for anyone who wants to stay connected. But if your partner is glued to their cell 24/7, it can obviously become a source of tension between you two. It\u2019s natural to feel a little jealous when someone you care about spends more time texting than talking with you, after all. And this is especially true if they seem to be ignoring you while they do so.
If your partner always seems to be on their phone, there could be several explanations \u2014 from an online affair to simply being an avid social media user. Regardless of the reasons why your partner might spend so much time on their phone, though, the way that you react definitely matters. Being insecure and accusatory about something as innocent as checking messages isn\u2019t likely to lead anywhere positive, after all. Here are some tips for dealing with a partner who\u2019s always on their phone:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Funniest Cat Videos on Youtube

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Success Rates of Mediation?

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is a dispute resolution process that involves the participation of a neutral third party called a mediator. The parties to the dispute agree to meet with the mediator and disclose facts, but not argue their case. Instead, the goal is for both sides to listen carefully to what the other has to say and explore possible compromises that are agreeable to both.
Mediation can be used at any stage of a dispute, from resolving initial grievances through settlement or arbitration. It can be used instead of litigation when there\u2019s no clear right or wrong side or when it\u2019s more cost-effective than adversarial proceedings. Research shows mediation can also make disputes last much shorter and cheaper than trials, reduce risk of lawsuits being refilled after settlement, and increase the likelihood of reaching an agreement in principle between parties.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Businesses?
What Are the Benefits of Mediation for Individuals?

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...s}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...s,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"In today\u2019s world, there is an increasing number of individuals who are becoming more and more stressed out. This is especially true for people who work in high-pressure jobs or have multiple responsibilities to fulfill. As a result, this has increased the demand for stress management techniques.One strategy that has been proven to reduce stress levels as well as anxiety and depression is meditation.People of all ages can benefit from meditation. It has been shown to promote relaxation, increase self-awareness, and alleviate anxiety, depression, and other negative emotions.Meditation involves focusing on a single thought or idea with little external distraction.This article discusses the benefits of mediation for individuals as well as how it can be implemented in one\u2019s life."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation is an increasingly popular alternative to litigation for resolving disputes outside of court. Parties agree to have a neutral third-party called a mediator act as an intermediary, bringing opposing parties together to resolve their dispute and avoid expensive and time-consuming court proceedings.
If you are involved in a lawsuit or other legal conflict, mediation can be beneficial in several ways. It can help you resolve your dispute faster and cheaper than going to trial. Mediation also has the potential to preserve your relationship with the other party after the dispute is resolved, which may prove useful if you anticipate interacting with that person again in the future. Lastly, mediation may give you more control over how your dispute is resolved, as opposed to leaving that up to an unpredictable judge or jury.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Ultimate Guide to Dog Grooming: Tips, Tricks and More!

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are naturally clean animals, but their fur can get dirty and oily over time. If left unattended, this dirt and oil will cause your dog to smell and leave them more susceptible to infections. Grooming your dog regularly can also help you identify any problems they might have with their skin or fur early on. To keep your dog healthy and happy, you should groom them once every one to three months.
The benefits of dog grooming go beyond a neatly trimmed coat and fresh smelling pet. Regular grooming helps to reduce the risk of infection from bacteria, decreases stress in the animal, stimulates blood circulation and improves self-confidence. The process is not only beneficial for the dog but also for you as an owner as it gives you time to build a stronger bond with your pet.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...i}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...i,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mediation has been practiced across cultures for thousands of years. It is a process that brings people together to resolve conflict and find mutually satisfying solutions. In mediation, an impartial third party assists the disputing parties in identifying the issues, exploring their own role in it and accessing their core needs to come up with a solution that works for all parties involved.
Mediation is a confidential process and there are many types of mediation depending on the nature of conflict. For example, dispute resolution could be focusing on specific issues such as environmental concerns or human resources issues; it could be between two parties such as divorce mediation or landlord-tenant mediation; it could be on a particular topic like civil rights mediation or criminal mediation; or it could be based on certain factors like age, gender, sexual orientation or physical ability. The following article explores the ways in which mediation can help you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Most Famous Cats in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to internet famous animals, cats by far come out on top. With the rise of social media, cat videos and memes have taken over the internet. There are so many funny cats online that it\u2019s almost ridiculous. These kitty clips have gained a massive following online and catapulted these lovable felines into superstardom.
Cats are a part of Internet Culture in ways that other animals just aren\u2019t. They also have unique features that make them much easier to anthropomorphize and create humorous images with. This has led to an explosion in popularity among cats of all kinds, but especially hilarious ones like Grumpy Cat, Henrietta, and Lil Bub. Now let\u2019s take a look at the Top 10 Famous Cats In The World:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
